body_html:
I also tried with NDK r11c, and it throws the same error. I believe it is something related with host platform of the cross-compilation which is x86_64 and the target Android compilation for x86 (32-bits).

It seems that Eigen is trying to use x86_64 instructions even if it is compiled for x86 (32-bits).

Using --cpu=armeabi-v7a it works fine.
body_text:
I also tried with NDK r11c, and it throws the same error. I believe it is something related with host platform of the cross-compilation which is x86_64 and the target Android compilation for x86 (32-bits).
It seems that Eigen is trying to use x86_64 instructions even if it is compiled for x86 (32-bits).
Using --cpu=armeabi-v7a it works fine.
body:
I also tried with NDK r11c, and it throws the same error. I believe it is something related with host platform of the cross-compilation which is x86_64 and the target Android compilation for x86 (32-bits).

It seems that Eigen is trying to use x86_64 instructions even if it is compiled for x86 (32-bits).

Using `--cpu=armeabi-v7a` it works fine.
